questionText: Which element is often included in phishing emails to create a sense of urgency?
answers: Detailed contact information
An urgent call to action
A reminder to follow safe browsing practices
A disclaimer about email authenticity

questionText: What phishing method involves attackers impersonating a reputable company through emails that contain malicious links?
answers: Link manipulation
Brand impersonation
Security spoofing
Credential harvesting

questionText: Phishing emails often include which of the following to trick the recipient?
answers: Authentic logos from reputable companies
Permission requests for software updates
Links to educational resources about cybersecurity
Certificates of email security

questionText: What should raise suspicion when you receive an email from a financial institution?
answers: The email uses a professional tone
It provides a link to the institution's official website
It asks for confirmation of personal financial details
The email includes the bank's official logo

questionText: How can you verify the authenticity of an email that appears to come from a trusted entity?
answers: By checking if the email address matches the entity's domain exactly
Replying to the email to see if you get a response
By calling the phone number provided in the email
If the email contains no spelling errors

questionText: A phishing email pretending to be from a tech company is asking you to verify your account. Which action should you take?
answers: Reply with the requested account details immediately to avoid account suspension
Ignore the email and log in to your account through the official website to check for any issues
Call the tech company on their official customer service number to verify the request
Forward the email to your contacts to see if they have received a similar request
